brief_title: Buprenorphine/Naloxone - Facilitated Rehabilitation for Opioid Dependent Adolescents - 1
brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare two 3-month treatments for adolescents/young adults who are addicted to heroin: buprenorphine/naloxone combined with psychosocial therapy and treatment as usual, a 7-14 day detoxification with buprenorphine and three weeks of psychosocial therapy.
criteria: Male and non-pregnant female subjects seeking outpatient treatment for opioid dependence with physiological features without serious medical or psychiatric disorders.
